Aside from interesting discussion on POE (more on that later), I don't
see=
 how redirect after post clashes with REST.

Since you're using HTML forms,=
 you are dealing with two
representations of a resource: text/html and
appl=
ication/x-www-form-urlencoded. And, you're dealing with another
resource --=
 the form, which effectively provides the schema for
application/x-www-form=
-urlencoded represntation. For instance:

html representation of resource: =
/resources/resource.html
urlencoded representation of resource: /resources/=
resource.urlencoded
html representation of the form: /forms/resource-schema=
.html

In this case, action of the form should point to /resource.urlencode=
d,
because that's the representation of the resource that the form is
deali=
ng with. However, knowing that user agents are not very
interested reading =
urlencoded data, I don't see anything wrong with it
always responding with =
302 Found (even for a GET) that points to
/resource.html after processing t=
he request.

So, anytime you POST or GET to /resource.urlencoded, you alway=
s get
redirected to /resource.html. It becomes the hidden or less preferred=

representation.
